title.narrative: Establishment Of The 2021-2030 Comprehensive Social Housing Policy In Vietnam

description.narrative:
To understand the limits and challenges of Viet Nam’s current social housing policies/ systems by analysing the housing conditions of the target beneficiary groups (low-income households and industrial workers), and by examining the accessibility aspects of social housing. The project must fit into a context where the urban authorities pain to structure its development in terms of social housing. This is partly due to the catch-up effect of Vietnamese cities related to demographic dynamism and industrialization development which took shape especially through the creation of industrial park in suburban spaces as the one in Bach Ninh.
Vietnam has experienced an exponential growth in cities since the 1990s. The population of cities has risen from 20% of the total population in 1990 to 35% in 2017 and trends are not expected to reverse in the short to medium term. The population of Hanoi today is estimated at 7.8 million inhabitants, when it was 2.6 million in 1999. In 2050 the urban population will have to be about 55% of the total Vietnamese population. At the last World Bank census in 2014, the proportion of urban population living in slums was 27.2%. The massive influx of migrants to the country’s main cities has led to population congestion and a rise of the informal settlements rate in all its forms, in a context where the housing supply was not able to meet the growing demand. The agglomeration effect also leads to higher house prices, aggrieving the difficulties that lower incomes, near poor and poor encounter in housing accessibility.
Social housing development by the government has reached only 33% of the targets they set for 2020, it means 81.700 apartments built. For example, in Hanoi the estimated demand is 110.000 social housing, because of the lack of land planning by localities, the difficulties of the state in financing the credit institutions and offset interest rates, and the lack data concerning the beneficiary groups. This reflects the need for the government to strengthen the policy framework concerning social housing, and to develop criteria more adapted to social, economic and urban realities. Thus, the project will identify the current status of social housing in Viet Nam and the conditions of eligibility for access to social housing with research about urban low income and industrial workers.
The project therefore intends to integrate national strategies as well as international development principles such as the Sustainable development goals. The mandate of UN Habitat is based on the implementation and principles of Goal 11 « Sustainable Cities and Communities » which are the following:
· Ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums
· Enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management
UN Habitat task and the project in which the program integrates will also have to meet the principles developed in goal 10 « Reduced inequalities » as:
· Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
· Adopt policies, especially fiscal, wage and social protection policies, and progressively achieve greater equality
In short term, UN Habitat research will contribute to project on social housing on particular KOICA social housing project and it also intends to develop research, policy consultation and capacity building to build vision and goals of social housing policies of Viet Nam but also amendments to improve social housing policies. In long term it will support the establishment of strategy for 2021-2030 Viet Nam Social Housing Development programme, its implementation Policies and Regulations. Thus this project would contribute to the improvement of the national strategy and policy for social housing.
